item.title: Premise and Purpose
item.description: A Start In my attempts at curating a repository of admittedly amateur philosophical essays, I find myself fairly challenged when trying to form a pure foundation of premises and axioms. It seems to me that any philosophy must start with a consistent set of premises or at least an intuitively sound few axioms to work from. Otherwise, the goal must be to engage with or potentially critique the established work of another â€” at least in as much as something fruitful may come from compounding one’s work on that of another.

item.title: Airport People
item.description: Who Airport People is the modern classical music of Leon Johnson. Originally from Arizona, Leon Johnson is a classically-trained violinist and a jazz-inspired multi-instrumentalist who finally found his voice as a post-classical minimalist under the moniker Airport People. Leon found his passion for classical music performance as a violinist in the prestigious International Chamber Ameropa master class program in Prague, Czech Republic. Since then, he has played upright bass for many local jazz combos, electric bass for the indie-rock band Broken Light, and played as a multi-instrumentalist for the indie-folk band The Year of the Hare out of Brooklyn, NY.
